Onboarding Customer Journey

This scenario introduces many features found in the Sitecore platform intended to help marketers create, manage, and report on customer journeys. Review the scenario steps below before starting your journey.
  • Step 1 - Track Incoming Contact and Campaign

    This scenario begins with an unknown contact that is using a search engine to find content. Lighthouse has created some pay-per-click (PPC) advertisements that are displayed to that contact on their search engine results page (Google, Bing, etc.). The goal of this step is to bring the unknown contact to the website while tracking that they came in via the PPC advertisement.

    Tracking an incoming contact can be accomplished with Sitecore's Campaign Creator tool which allows marketers to create and manage campaigns at scale. An individual campaign code is created in Sitecore that can be appended to any incoming links.

    For example:
    https://example.com?sc_camp=7F3D54DB06A84146897E5036BCC9315A

    The information captured via the campaign code in Sitecore is critical for reporting and analytics purposes and helps marketers determine if a campaign is performing as expected or needs attention. You will see more about Sitecore's analytics and reporting at the end of this scenario.

  • Step 2 - Identify Contact and Collect Consent

    The goal of this step is customer acquisition. The visitor arrives on the website at an article page that contains a call-to-action form. If the visitor submits the call-to-action form, we are able to do the following:

    • Use the visitor's email address to turn them into a known contact in Sitecore's Experience Database
    • Trigger a Sitecore goal (which can be used for personalization or other purposes in the current and future visits)
    • Attempt to collect consent information for re-marketing opportunities
    • Send a confirmation email
    • Enroll the visitor in a Marketing Automation plan to nurture new contacts

    The visitor will receive an email after submitting the call-to-action form due to implied consent but it is important that we collect consent information from the visitor if we wish to send marketing emails in the future.

  • Step 3 - Control the Customer Journey with Marketing Automation Plans

    In this step the visitor has been placed in a Marketing Automation plan to help control the customer journey for new contact acquisitions.

    The Marketing Automation plan will check visitor consent information and will only re-market if consent has been given. If no consent has been given we remove the contact from the Marketing Automation plan and place them on a contact list for later use.

    The goal of the Marketing Automation plan is to direct visitors to complete other goals on the website. The follow up goals involve completing a 3-step questionnaire and creating a new account in order to gather more information about the visitor.

    You can review the plan by going to the Marketing Automation app on the Sitecore dashboard. The Marketing Automation plan is named New Contact - Onboarding Customer Journey.

  • Step 4 - A/B and Multivariate Testing

    In this step the visitor clicks a link in one of the emails and is taken to a marketing landing page. The landing page has a single call-to-action that is currently in an active A/B test.

    There are 3 active variations of the content and image used in the call-to-action. Sitecore collects visitor data to determine which test variant is most effective. In this scenario, effectiveness is determined by how many visitors complete the 3-step questionnaire per test variant.

  • Step 5 - Personalization in Action

    In this step the visitor completes a 3-step questionnaire. The questionnaire is built with Sitecore Forms and is designed to collect more information about the visitor.

    This will also show an example of personalization in action. Your personalized digital fitness trainer is based on your answers in the 3-step questionnaire and uses Sitecore personalization to display the result.

  • Step 6 - Create a New Account

    The ultimate goal of the Onboarding Customer Journey is to have visitors register for a new account.

    The final step of the initial Marketing Automation plan is to send them an email about registration. If the visitor does create a new account, then the following will occur:
    • A registration confirmation email is sent
    • The contact is placed in a new Marketing Automation plan named "New Account Registration" to nurture new registrants.
  • Step 7 - Reporting and Analytics

    Time to review all of the great data captured during the customer journey! This information will help marketers track ROI and create a feedback loop to determine if marketing efforts are successful and how to make them more effective.

    Here are some important reports to review at the end of the scenario. These reports are all available from the Sitecore Dashboard.

    1. Experience Profile
      • Search for your contact by email in the search bar in order to see a detailed breakdown of everything you accomplished on the website.
    2. Experience Analytics
      • Lots of reporting here but check out the "Audience -> Pattern matches" report to see how visitors are being profiled on the website based on their browsing habits and information collected. Which type of visitor has the highest conversion rate?
    3. Path Analyzer
      • This tool creates an aggregated visual representation of the customer journey. Look for the green and red nodes to identify areas of high conversion and ares of drop-off.
      • Don't forget to apply the filter maps to view specific customer journeys such as the one for the Sitecore Campaign in this scenario.

    These analytics tools combine to show a holistic view of the customer journey. From an individual site visit to an aggregated visual representation of the customer journey, Sitecore's analytics and reporting capabilities will take marketing to the next level.

Get Started

Important: Ensure you are using incognito mode or a fresh browser session before starting the scenario. Open this page in the new browser session and click the button below to begin.

Start Scenario
